1.3.20  6:14 am   so for the longest time i've been stuck voicing chords like a baby on piano. meaning like if there were a Cmaj7 on a leadsheet i would instinctively play it like (C,E,G,B)

      in the left hand AND (C,E,G,B) in the right hand.

      It seems kind of dumb but my entire understanding of music and how i made sense of harmony came from root voicing block chords. But it's a serious rut. because obviously listening to your music there's a whole other thing to it which i interpret as "sparse-ness". Meaning EVERY note can MATTER and hold serious weight leading into wherever it goes. I just suppose this anyway...But for Years i couldn't begin to understand the logic to it. Meanwhile, I plowed through a harmony book. learned about all these cool chords Outside of the major scale that relate to the major scale. and implement them as well as fun time signatures into my work in a way that was organic and good. but i still do the dumb chord thing. and so like a year ago to h opefully evolve and understand why I needed to change I started transcribing pop songs i enjoyed, completely. even maracas for like one upbeat on a single measure. So I think my ear is getting better because of that. i mean it might be ridiculous. considering i'm sure even the players for "running on empty"-jackson browne were looking at Much simpler charts than what they actually played. but i insist on doing it. Anyway! So all this time passes in my development and i still feel like i'd immediately fall face first if i were let out in the real world because of the chord thing.

      throughout all this time i would ask people "how do i get out of this habit, how do i change?" and they said almost every time "...just do it? there's literally nothing stopping you." which seemed kind of asshole-ish. cuz it didn't really seem like advice. but lo and behold, last night i just "did it" and i can't explain how i "did it". i just did. the comping/voice leading was beautiful. it was honestly jus t a deci sion to do it.

      and it kind of pisses me off because i could've done this THE WHOLE TIME!! but i literally can't explain it. it's ethereal. something fundamental in ME must've changed, or something. have you ever experienced anything like this?

      not even just music but like being in a situation where "there's a thing you want to do, you know what it is you gotta do, but something peculiarly vague in your bones is holding you back"?

1.2.20  11:02 pm   Right now in Australia we're dealing with our worst fires in recorded history and have lost almost 500 million animals and quite a few people, including volunteer firefighters. Over 14 million acres have been burnt. That's twice the size of Belgium. It's scary and hard to comprehend.
I'm lucky enough not to be affected but I feel dreadful not being able to help. I've managed to donate $130 dollars but it feels like nothing. It wouldnt even scratch the surface. It might put fuel in 2 cars with small tanks. It can't buy even a cheap firefighting pump, or hardly any livestock feed, or other necessities like that. It brings me to tears knowing I'm capable of so little because of my lack of money. Sometimes I wish I were rich, purely for the ability to fucking help more and make an actual difference.
Sorry, I just had to vent a bit. I can't express these feelings to people around me because ffs, these selfish issues are nothing compared with w hat the people affected are dealing with and it's childish of me to think like this. Wtf can I do? I'm just one person.
